channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Wuhan is on a slow path back to normality after 76-day coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The first city in the world to go into lockdown due to the coronavirus is slowly returning to something that might be described as normal, after months of fear and anxiety.

item.title: Wuhan resident: A second wave is 'absolutely' coming
item.description: CNN's David Culver returns to Wuhan, China the original epicenter of the novel coronavirus. The city's 11 million residents are attempting to return to normal life and business after a 76-day lockdown.

item.title: There's a long way to go before things return to normal in Wuhan
The dangerous morality behind the 'Open it Up' movement
item.description: A healthcare worker in green scrubs stands in the middle of an intersection, staring down a traffic jam of screaming protesters demanding a return to their livelihoods and liberties.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine trial on humans starts as UK warns restrictions could stay in place until next year
item.description: Scientists in the UK will begin trials of a potential Covid-19 vaccine on humans Thursday, as the government warns it could have to rely on social distancing measures until next year assuming no vaccine or treatment is found before then.

item.title: Merkel: Germany is on thinnest ice' | India's air improves
What you need to know about coronavirus today
Anderson Cooper presses mayor over wish to reopen
item.description: Las Vegas Mayor Carolyn Goodman (I) says that she wants to reopen the city's casinos, restaurants and entertainment venues for business so people can get back to work. CNN's Anderson Cooper asks her if that's safe given the data about the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: How negative oil prices could set the stage for the next price boom
Trump disregards science as chaos overtakes coronavirus response
item.description: Alarming new signs are emerging that the Trump administration is shunting science aside in the battle against coronavirus.

item.title: Another 4.4 million Americans filed for unemployment benefits last week
item.description: For the fifth week in a row, millions of American workers applied for unemployment benefits, seeking financial relief as businesses remained closed during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Trump: I told Georgia governor I disagree with decision to reopen
item.description: President Trump said he told Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp that he disagreed strongly with his plan to reopen some businesses in the state during the coronavirus pandemic, but added, "He has to do what he thinks is right."

item.title: Nevada governor responds to Las Vegas mayor's remarks
item.description: Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak responds to Las Vegas Mayor Carolyn Goodman's comments to CNN's Anderson Cooper appearing to offer the city as a control group for coronavirus guidelines.

item.title: A seemingly healthy woman's sudden death is now the first known US coronavirus-related fatality, LA Times reports
item.description: A seemingly healthy 57-year-old Bay Area woman who "suddenly died" in early February has now become the first known US death related to coronavirus, the Los Angeles Times reported Wednesday.

item.title: This nurse used to read her children bedtime stories. Now she writes them essays in case she dies
item.description: Lucy Stewart never used to enjoy doing the laundry.

item.title: Air pollution in northern India has hit a 20-year low, NASA report says
item.description: For years, northern India -- especially the capital New Delhi -- has been battling air pollution with levels hitting the hazardous mark during the winter season.

item.title: Nearly all Covid-19 patients put on ventilators in NY's largest health system died: study
Cocaine worth $23.5 million seized at UK port
item.description: UK police have seized 190 kilograms (419 pounds) of cocaine with an estimated street value of £19 million ($23.5 million) at the port of Dover.

item.title: Trump says he told Navy to 'shoot down and destroy' Iranian boats that harass US ships
item.description: President Donald Trump tweeted Wednesday that he has instructed the US Navy to "shoot down and destroy any and all Iranian gunboats" that harass US ships.

item.title: New photos of Prince Louis painting rainbows released to mark his second birthday
item.description: The Royal Family has released photographs of Prince Louis painting rainbows to mark his second birthday.

item.title: Asian wet markets get bad press. See what they're really like
item.description: A common sight across Asia, wet markets traditionally sell fresh produce and live animals. Some include wild animal products linked to diseases. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout explains the diverse array of wet markets in Asia.

item.title: She paid $68,000 to do an MBA at Cambridge. Now she's studying via Zoom in India
item.description: Srishti Warman spent years dreaming about doing an MBA at Cambridge University's Judge Business School.

item.title: How coronavirus has changed Ramadan for Muslims this year
item.description: Thursday marks the start of the holy month of Ramadan for many Muslims.

item.title: Simona Halep's lockdown life: military on the streets, slower pace at home
item.description: While soldiers are patrolling the streets of Bucharest, Wimbledon champion Simona Halep has been adjusting to a new, different pace of life.

item.title: Formula One team boss says season could start in July
item.description: Otmar Szafnauer, team principal of Racing Point F1 Team, believes the Formula One season could start in July without fans present.

item.title: Shocking footage shows young men looting truck for food
item.description: Nigeria's lockdown is making life increasingly difficult for the country's poor. CNN's Stephanie Busari reports from Lagos on the desperation many face.

item.title: Coronavirus test can produce false negatives, company says
item.description: Abbott Laboratories, the maker of a rapid coronavirus test widely used across the United States and distributed by the federal government, has warned that its device can produce false negatives if a special solution is used to move or store patients' samples. CNN's Drew Griffin has the details.

item.title: Jellyfish seen swimming in Venice's canals
item.description: Spotting a beautiful jellyfish serenely swimming through near-transparent waters in the canals of Venice would've been an unthinkable sight just a few weeks ago, but the global standstill created by coronavirus has now made it possible.

item.title: With no people, safari owners fear a rise in poaching
item.description: Safari operators say a lack of business has a secondary sinister affect on the animals in the African wilderness areas.

item.title: Man is trying to visit every nation in the world without flying. But he's stuck in Hong Kong due to Covid-19
item.description: Torbjørn "Thor" Pedersen is on a mission to visit every country in the world in a single journey, without taking a single flight.

item.title: Black women sue golf course that called cops alleging they were playing too slow
item.description: Two African American women who allege that management at a Pennsylvania golf course mistreated them when they called police because they were playing too slow have now filed a lawsuit claiming racial and gender discrimination.

item.title: CNN analyst calls out WH virus expert: She shied away
item.description: CNN's Gloria Borger criticizes Dr. Deborah Birx's comments during a coronavirus task force briefing, in which Birx responded to Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp's announcement that some businesses will be allowed to reopen this week.

item.title: Family spoke to dad on phone for 30 hours before he died from Covid-19
item.description: A family merged their phone calls together to be a part of the last moments their father had in his hospital bed before dying from Covid-19.

item.title: Seniors with Covid-19 show unusual symptoms, doctors say
12 Frank Lloyd Wright buildings are now hosting virtual tours
item.description: Ever wanted to go inside Frank Lloyd Wright's iconic Fallingwater? Now's your chance (even if the US is on lockdown) thanks to a new series of digital tours.

item.title: Roger Federer receives support after urging tennis to unify during the coronavirus crisis
item.description: Roger Federer says the current lockdown is the perfect opportunity for tennis to merge the men's and women's governing bodies.

item.title: Sotheby's sets new online auction record despite coronavirus gloom
item.description: Despite shuttering outposts around the world and furloughing staff due to the coronavirus pandemic, Sotheby's has just pulled off its biggest ever online art auction.

item.title: Lockdowns lead to air pollution drops in major cities
item.description: A study shows that air pollution levels have fallen by unprecedented levels in several major global cities amid coronavirus lockdowns.

item.title: Massive 'ice shoves' threaten lakeside homes
item.description: See 30-foot-tall ice walls, also known as "ice shoves," move into lakeside homes in Minnesota. Warm weather has caused the ice on the lake to thaw causing ice waves to slowly crash into homes on the shore.

item.title: Stanley Tucci shows off quarantine bartending skills
item.description: Actor Staley Tucci takes to Instagram to show off his bartending skills with a video of himself teaching followers how to make the perfect Negroni.

item.title: See how our planet has changed in 50 years
item.description: Since the first Earth Day in 1970, we haven't made as much progress on protecting the environment as you might think.

item.title: Traveling again with bed sheets and laundry machines
item.description: TikTok and Instagram users have figured out ways to reimagine their vacation plans using a little stop animation and a slew of camera tricks.

item.title: Earth Day photos: The world's beauty is at risk
item.description: The world is full of natural wonders, but at a time when borders are closing and travel is restricted, seeing them in person is not a realistic option for many people. Thankfully, technology lets us to see the world virtually and visit these magical places -- if only through our screens.

item.title: Almost half of coronavirus deaths in Europe were in care homes, WHO says
What Trump and Fox News said about hydroxychloroquine
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter says that Fox News hosts have been silent about a test that appears to link hydroxychloroquine to an increased death rate in Covid-19 patients after weeks of touting the drug as a treatment for the virus.

item.title: 'House of horror': The awful economic data for April is here
Trump's false claims about governors not wanting tests, Pelosi and Michelle Obama
item.description: • Analysis: As Americans face a new normal, Trump returns to old playbook • Some states are retracing their timelines after the discovery of earlier deaths

item.title: Anderson Cooper's absolutely wild interview with the mayor of Las Vegas
item.description: • Watch: Vegas mayor appears to offer city as control group for coronavirus

item.title: Nearly all patients on ventilators in a health system died, study finds
item.description: Nearly all coronavirus patients who needed ventilators in New York's largest health system to help them breathe died, a study found.

item.title: See what London's major sites look like under lockdown
item.description: London's tourist guides have lost their income and way of life due to the nation's shutdown over the pandemic. CNN's John Torigoe shows us how they continue to promote the city they love using social media.
